item.title: Favorite R Packages
item.description: Sourcing data rio - simplify importing and exporting data across source formats readxl - importing Excel files including individual worksheets datapasta - copy/paste data using clipboard rvest - A set of useful tools for working with http connections Wrangling dplyr - transform and summarize data frames purrr - functional programming to automate functions tidyr - change the layout of data sets magrittr - set of operators to make code more readable such as the pipe stringr - manipulate regular expressions and character strings.

item.title: Favorite links
item.description: R Programming Fundamentals “R for Data Science” — seminal Tidyverse primer by Hadley Wickham & Garrett Grolemund “Learning R Step by Step” - hard copy book by Richard Cotton Statistics with R — online Duke courses via Coursera R Programming — online Johns Hopkins class via Coursera Data Cleaning with R — online Johns Hopkins class via Coursera Tidyverse Ggplot2 extensions Online Community R for Data Science (R4DS) Online Learning Community Tidy Tuesday - data sets to practice Tidyverse concepts Tidy Tuesday Rocks - R Shiny compilation of Tidy Tuesday submissions Data Visualization Fundamentals “Fundamentals of Data Visualization” — free online book by Claus Wilke.

item.title: Visualizations
item.description: A collection of data visualizations I have built for fun using the R programming language. All visualizations are produced via code without post-processing. The examples source data from the weekly R4DS #TidyTuesday project, which is a community for R and tidyverse enthusisasts to practice and share ideas in wrangling, exploring and visualizing data.
